definitions.text: producing or capable of producing an intended result or having a striking effect; -LewisMumford
examples: an air-cooled motor was more effective than a witch's broomstick for rapid long-distance transportation
his complaint proved to be effectual in bringing action

definitions.text: able to accomplish a purpose; functioning effectively; -G.B.Shaw
examples: people who will do nothing unless they get something out of it for themselves are often highly effective persons...
the efficient cause of the revolution

definitions.text: works well as a means or remedy
examples: a lotion that is effective in cases of prickly heat
a warranty good for two years
the law is already in effect (or in force)

definitions.text: existing in fact; not theoretical; real
examples: a decline in the effective demand
confused increased equipment and expenditure with the quantity of effective work done
the fort was held by about 100 effective soldiers
